title: Windows 10 Update and FPS Stuck at 60
body: So yea recently i updated my Windows 10 and normaly i had about 270 fps in game playing lol , now after update my fps freeze at 60 , fps is uncapped , vsync is off, any solutions ?

replies.body: You may need to update your drivers after the update so your game can render properly.  That would be the best first step, but there could be other factors for frames dropping.  Go over our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide for a list of instructions to tune up your PC!  That should get you squared away!

Same here. I reinstalled my graphics card drivers, set VSync off in-game&Nvidia Control Panel and FPS is still capped at 60. An input lag is also present since the update.

UPDATE: It seems like this problem occurred before. I did some research and managed to fix it.
1. Go to start menu
2. Search for Xbox app
3. Log in
4. After logging in, on the left side of the app window there should be a vertical taskbar-like menu; click the cogwheel icon(Settings)
5. Go to Game DVR tab and switch it off
This worked for me, other ppl stated that it didn't help.
If you "mistakenly" uninstalled the app, do the following(simply installing it from the store didn't work for me, i couldn't log in)
1. Run PowerShell as administrator(start, search power shell, rclick->run as administrator)
2. Run the following commands:
       Get-AppxPackage *windowsstore* | Remove-AppxPackage
       Get-AppxPackage *xboxapp* | Remove-AppxPackage
3. Restart your PC
4. When it boots back up, reopen PowerShell in the same way and run the following command:
       Get-AppxPackage -AllUsers| Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register “$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml”} 
5. Now you should be able to sign in into Xbox and disable that option
That option is a recording tool from Xbox which will cap your FPS at 60 and will introduce a slight input lag(which is pretty annoying tbh)
Hope this helped,
Cheers.

> [{quoted}](name=Xdemkaas,realm=EUNE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=WFZwhONW,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-08-20T18:03:57.390+0000)

> 5. Now you should be able to sign in into Xbox and disable that option

WELL DONE MATE WELL DONE. FINALLY my fps is above 180

Thanks a ton, it worked for me!
I Truned off the Game DVR but still i get 60 fps , in-game the fps is uncapped .... I turned V-Sync off from the game and my graphic ... What should i do ?

Go to your client's .exe file > Properties > Compatibility tab and check Disable fullscreen optimization.
Worked for me :)

> [{quoted}](name=Life in Mid,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=WFZwhONW,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-06-05T20:14:40.255+0000)
>
> Go to your client's .exe file > Properties > Compatibility tab and check Disable fullscreen optimization.
> Worked for me :)
yo shout out to you my man i've had so much trouble fixing it now its fixed thank you

To fix this problem, go to the game that you are having the problem on, right click on it and click properties. In properties, you want to go to the compatibility tab and tick 'Disable fullscreen optimizations.'
Thx mate, Very helpfull!
Honored
It worked ty!!!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Worked for me. Thanks!

Same issue. No changes to my preferences, but i'm capped at 60fps. Setting is at uncapped, and I normally run in the 200+fps.

Also, had to restart my game a few times because frames dip to 20-30 during combat because im not getting my usual 200+fps.
